byline.contributor: Zhang Tiantian contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Chinese officials vow to punish 123 government workers for 2015 explosions at Rui Hai International-owned chemical warehouse in Tianjin that killed 165 people and caused $1.1 billion in damage; promise follows report finding blasts were result of mismanagement and lax oversight.
lead_paragraph: Citing dereliction of duty, Chinese cabinet officials vowed to punish 123 government workers in connection with the blasts in August, which killed 165 people.

headline.main: Tianjin Explosions Were Result of Mismanagement, China Finds
headline.print_headline: China Vows to Punish Managers for Inferno

snippet: Citing dereliction of duty, Chinese cabinet officials vowed to punish 123 government workers in connection with the blasts in August, which killed 165 people.

keywords.value: Rui Hai International Logistics Co Ltd
keywords.name: organizations
